page.title: 09Education in North Abingdon
page.content: In our block we found out there were nine educational establishments-Four primary schools,one Junior school,one nursery (3-4),two secondary schools, and a College of further education. The "schools" with age groups and pupil numbers are as follows. Dumore Nursery(3-4)-60 pupis; Dunmore Infants(5-7)-220 pupils; Dumore Juniors (7-11)-325 pupils; Manor Prep(4-11)-277 pupils; Fitzharrys(11-18)-1000 pupils; Radley College(13-18)-594 pupils;Rush Common-(5-11)-415 pupils; College of F.E.(16-65)-5000 students; Sunningwell (5-11)-39 pupils. All seven educational establishments in North Abingdon were built after the second world war because, before that time,North Abingdon only had houses in Northcourt.The rest was farmland. The two independent schools have twice the number of teachers as the others.
